answers.answer: To add, genetic factors means if you have family history of diabetes your chances of being diabetic are high. One reason is you picked up your parents bad habits [consciously and unconsciously] - poor food choices, lack of exercise, and excessive weight.The other is you inherited your parents, or grandparents diabetic gene.

Hi,To me the most important factor is Consuming large amount of sugar for a long time for example: anyone that drinks 2 cans of soda, 64OZ of sugary drinks a day. for the last 10 years is likely a pre-diabetic 2 or already a diabetic 2.To test oneself for Diabetes 2 disease, buy a home-test kit called A1C NOW at Walmart or Walsgreen for less than $28 dollars,A pre-diabetic2 is, like a little pregnant, will be a full blown Diabetic 2 sooner or later, in the next 2 to 5 years.Heridity play  a little role, Sport activities won't help much, remember the great Jackie Robinson died of this disease due to his orange juice drinking.
